dailyContent.notificationText: Test text

home.title: A small step with a big impact

pages.title: Welcome to the Big Ranch! Here we are going to explore the impact of meat and what you can do about it.
There is one small step everyone can take to immediately reduce their impact ü•æ
What makes a bigger difference?
pages.subtitle: for reducing CO2 in average European or North American diet

answerExplanation.text:
Beef has by far the highest footprint of any meat. Without eating any less meat, this step alone would reduce the carbon footprint of the average Western diet by one-fifth!

Of course, replacing beef with chicken (or pork) is not the end goal of a sustainable diet. But it‚Äôs an easy first step that already makes a huge difference.

pages.subtitle: This is one of our favorite recipes and a great way to turn a classic beef recipe vegetarian.

pages.title: Come back tomorrow to discover the climate impact of nuts

dailyContent.notificationText: What‚Äôs the climate impact of nuts? ü•ú¬†- Recipe of the day: White Wine Mushroom Tagliatelle

home.title: What‚Äôs the climate impact of nuts?

pages.title: In the plant kingdom, nuts are the food with the highest amount of protein üí™
So nuts could be a good replacement for meat. But what about their carbon footprint?
Compared to meat, the carbon footprint of nuts is...

answerExplanation.text: Nuts have lots of protein and an extremely low footprint because they grow on trees. Together with their healthy fats, nuts are a great source of protein and replacement for meat.

pages.subtitle: The walnuts in this creamy pasta dish not only provide some extra protein but also a delicious crunch.

dailyContent.notificationText: Why does food have a high footprint?¬†ü§î¬†- Recipe of the day: Minty Aubergine Wraps

home.title: Why food has such a high footprint

pages.title: There are lots of different issues with our food system üçΩ
What is the main reason why food has a high footprint?

answerExplanation.text:
Most of us live in cities and don‚Äôt realize that farmland is the main way that humans are changing the surface of the Earth.

Food production takes up half of all habitable land on Earth (excluding ice and deserts). Most of this land is used to produce meat and dairy.

pages.subtitle: This recipe uses a lot less land than a tortilla with ground beef.

dailyContent.notificationText: Do you know the biggest cause of deforestation? ü™ì¬†- Recipe of the day: Green Lemon Spaghetti

home.title: What‚Äôs the biggest cause of deforestation?

pages.title: Here at the Fading Forest we‚Äôre going to look at why forests are cut down ü™ì
Nearly all deforestation happens in tropical and subtropical countries. But what‚Äôs the biggest cause?
What is the biggest cause of deforestation?

answerExplanation.text:
The most forest is destroyed to create pastures for cows. A majority of this deforestation happens in South America.

We will take a closer look at soy and palm oil on our next visit to the Fading Forest.

pages.subtitle: A green meal to save the green forests of the world.

dailyContent.notificationText: Eat more of this climate superfood¬†ü§©¬†- Recipe of the day: Coconut Dahl (this is one of our favorites)

home.title: Eat more of this climate superfood

pages.title: There is a family of plants that are both super healthy AND sustainable: legumes üôå
What makes them unique is that they produce a simple dry fruit.
What is NOT a legume?

answerExplanation.text:
Legumes are small dry fruit that we know as chickpeas, lentils, peas, or beans.

Like nuts, they have a lot of protein for a very low footprint. But legumes have even more environmental benefits like needing very little water.

pages.subtitle: The cornerstone of this dish is red lentils, one of the easiest and most delicious ways to cook with legumes.

dailyContent.notificationText: How does 1 vegan compare to 2 vegetarians?¬†üçΩ¬†- Recipe of the day: Spanish Rice

home.title: Let‚Äôs have more dinner parties

pages.title: Making responsible food choices can be very difficult with so much confusing information üòµ‚Äçüí´
So it‚Äôs important to keep in mind the bigger picture.
What saves more emissions?

answerOptions.title: 3 people who replace beef with pork & chicken

answerExplanation.text:
Inspiring one other person to replace beef with chicken makes a much bigger difference than trying to make perfect decisions by yourself.

Food is social. And the solution to a sustainable food system should be social, too! So share a recipe or infographic and let‚Äôs have sustainable dinner parties.

pages.subtitle: This recipe is a veggie party!

dailyContent.notificationText: Do you know where most food is wasted?¬†üóë¬†- Recipe of the day: African Peanut Soup

home.title: Where is most food wasted?

pages.title: About one third of all food is wasted üò¢
In Western countries, most food is wasted...

answerExplanation.text: More than half of all food waste in North America and Europe happens at consumption (home + restaurants & catering). That means all of us have a role to play.

pages.subtitle: Soup recipes are perfect for dipping some leftover bread.

dailyContent.notificationText: The weight of all humans and their farm animals¬†‚öñÔ∏è¬†- Recipe of the day: Creamy Mushroom Pasta

home.title: The weight of humanity

pages.title: Imagine you would take all humans of the planet and put them on a scale ‚öñÔ∏è
Would they weigh more than all wild mammals?
What is the heaviest group on Earth?

answerExplanation.text:
All cows are heavier than all humans and wild mammals combined! They are also heavier than all other livestock animals combined (pigs, chickens, sheep, goats, horses).

You might say that we are living on Planet Cow‚Ä¶

pages.subtitle: Another recipe where plants are the main ingredient (although mushrooms are technically fungi).

dailyContent.notificationText: Should you eat more nuts? ü•ú¬†- Recipe of the day: Peanut Fruit Curry

home.title: Should you eat more nuts?

pages.title: In 2019, a group of 37 scientists calculated what a healthy AND sustainable diet would look like ü•ó
They reached an interesting conclusion about nuts & legumes.
How often should we eat nuts & legumes? ü•ú

answerExplanation.text:
Right now we only eat 19 g per day, while it should be 125 g. Nuts and legumes are the most sustainable way to replace meat and dairy.

Try to eat at least one portion of nuts and one portion of legumes every day. So get out the peanut butter jar! üòçü•ú

pages.subtitle: With this recipe you‚Äôve already reached half of the recommended amount of nuts and legumes.

dailyContent.notificationText: [This is already your¬†üîüth day!] Four sources of protein¬†üí™¬†- Recipe of the day: Farfalle Primavera

home.title: Where do we get protein?

pages.title: A lot of people are worried about protein when eating less meat üò∞
While it‚Äôs true that meat contains a lot of protein, there are other sources, too.
In the average European diet, what provides most protein?

answerExplanation.text:
Cereals like pasta, rice, and bread are the most important energy source for humanity because of their carbs. But they also contain a lot more protein than you think.

These products - especially the whole grain version - are essential for a sustainable diet because they make us less dependent on protein from meat and dairy.

pages.subtitle: A meal with four sources of protein: pasta, beans, peas, and hazelnuts.

dailyContent.notificationText: The most important fact about soy¬†üìä¬†- Recipe of the day: Brazilian Strogonof

home.title: The most important fact about soy

pages.title: Last time we saw that soy is a big cause of deforestation together with beef and palm oil  ü™ì
What is most soy used for?

answerExplanation.text:
The majority of soy is used as animal feed, mostly for chickens and pigs. 

The soy used for products like yogurt or tofu is only a small part of the total soy production (6,9%) and is a good building block of a sustainable diet.

pages.subtitle: Most of the world‚Äôs soy comes from Brazil, so here is meatless version of a Brazilian classic.

dailyContent.notificationText: Why does beef have such a high footprint?¬†üêÆ¬†- Recipe of the day: Mushroom Coconut Rice

home.title: Why does beef have such a high footprint?

pages.title: Some meat has a much higher footprint than others ü•©
The reason for this is the way their stomach works.
Which of these is NOT a ruminant?

answerExplanation.text:
Ruminants have a special stomach that makes it possible to eat grass. In this process, they burp a gas called methane, which is a strong greenhouse gas.

Methane is a big reason why beef - but also goat and sheep meat - has a much higher footprint than other food.

pages.subtitle: Meat has a strong umami flavor, but this recipe is also full of umami from the mushrooms, soy sauce, and fried onions.

dailyContent.notificationText: What happens when you don‚Äôt finish your plate?¬†ü§≠¬†- Recipe of the day: Oven Pesto Potatoes

home.title: The impact of food waste

pages.title: Wasting food always feels bad‚Ä¶ üóë
But how is it related to climate change?
Why is wasting food so problematic?

answerOptions.title: More food needs to be produced
More space is required for landfills

answerExplanation.text: Saving a small leftover means that you can later have a ‚Äòfree‚Äô meal. It might seem insignificant whether you save half a sandwich. But if 1% of Europeans save half a sandwich, that‚Äôs 3-4 million sandwiches worth of food that doesn‚Äôt need to be produced.

pages.subtitle: This is a great recipe to add any leftover veggies you have.

dailyContent.notificationText: How does cheese compare to meat?¬†üßÄ¬†- Recipe of the day: Crunchy Noodles

home.title: How does cheese compare to meat?

pages.title: Many people who eat less meat find it much harder to eat less cheese üßÄ
So what's the climate footprint of cheese compared to meat?
Which meal has the lowest footprint?

answerExplanation.text:
The easiest way to cook a vegetarian meal is to replace meat with cheese. But that‚Äôs like taking two steps forward and one step back. 

We don‚Äôt have to ban cheese from our diets but it shouldn‚Äôt be a staple of everyday life. We think the answer is saving cheese for special occasions and weekends.

pages.subtitle: Cheese has a strong umami flavor but you can also get it from ingredients. In this case: soy sauce.

dailyContent.notificationText: What are all those corn fields for?¬†üåΩ¬†- Recipe of the day: Orange Prune Rice

home.title: What are all those corn fields for?

pages.title: Cereals like wheat or corn are not just grown for humans üåΩ
We also turn them into animal feed or biofuel.
How much of the cereal production is for humans?
pages.subtitle: In the EU

answerExplanation.text:
Less than a quarter of EU cereals is for direct human consumption. Animal feed is by far the biggest destination. 

That means that for every day you don‚Äôt eat meat and dairy, you save about 1 kg of cereals.

pages.subtitle: A delicious recipe without animal products, so no need for feed!

dailyContent.notificationText: What is the most wasted product?¬†üóë¬†- Recipe of the day: Pink Pasta

home.title: What is the most wasted product?

pages.title: In terms of weight, fruit and veggies are the most wasted product because they contain a lot of water.
But what if we look at the ‚Äòenergy‚Äô that is wasted? ‚ö°Ô∏è
What makes up more than half of all wasted calories?

answerExplanation.text:
Worldwide, 53% of all wasted calories come from cereals. It takes a lot of land and fertilizer to grow cereals so wasting them is more harmful than wasting most fruits and veggies.

Every leftover pasta or stale bread you eat is a win for the climate.

pages.subtitle: A pasta recipe to practice the right amount of pasta you need per person to avoid leftovers.

dailyContent.notificationText: Should you try to avoid palm oil?¬†üå¥¬†- Recipe of the day: Indonesian Spicy Cabbage

home.title: Should you try to avoid palm oil?

pages.title: Together with beef and soy, palm oil is a major cause of deforestation üå¥
So let‚Äôs investigate a possible solution.
Replacing palm oil with other oils would require...
pages.subtitle: (per kg of oil)

answerExplanation.text:
Palm oil is by far the most efficient oil crop! That means replacing palm oil with other products would require much more land and shift the problem to other areas. It‚Äôs a complicated issue. 

The best thing we can do as individuals is to eat less processed food because that‚Äôs where palm oil is used: ice cream, cookies, pizza, and ready-made meals.

pages.subtitle: A tribute to Indonesia, where a lot of rainforest has been destroyed to make space for palm oil plantations.

dailyContent.notificationText: A climate tip for the meat lovers in your life¬†üçñ¬†- Recipe of the day: Roast Potatoes with Mustard

home.title: A climate tip for meat lovers

pages.title: Chicken has the lowest footprint of all meat üçó
But what happens if we also look at portion sizes?
What has the lowest footprint?

answerExplanation.text: Chicken and pork are always a better option than beef. But it also matters how big the serving size is. Some bacon bits can give a dish lots of flavor without using a lot of meat.

pages.subtitle: Since you probably know enough recipes with bacon, here is a nice potato recipe where you don‚Äôt need meat.

dailyContent.notificationText: How polluting are food miles?¬†üõ£¬†- Recipe of the day: Banana Curry

home.title: How polluting are food miles?

pages.title: Our food sometimes travels halfway around the world üåè
But not all transport methods have the same impact.
Which type of transport has the lowest footprint?
pages.subtitle: per tonne of food

answerExplanation.text:
Big freight ships are also polluting but they can carry A LOT of containers, so the emissions per product are very low. 

That means transport emissions play a much smaller role than most people think.

pages.subtitle: We can eat bananas in mainland Europe thanks to the transport by ship from banana-producing regions. Let‚Äôs enjoy them in this wonderful curry.

dailyContent.notificationText: [Day number¬†2Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£¬†Woohoo!] Are you eating enough protein?¬†üí™¬†- Recipe of the day: Caribbean Chilli

home.title: Are you eating enough protein?

pages.title: Before looking at how to get enough protein we need to answer a different question.
How much protein do we need? ü§î
Somone with the average Western diets eats...

answerExplanation.text:
The average 30-year-old man needs about 63 grams of protein per day, and the average woman around 54 grams. 

If you leave out all meat and dairy you need a bit more protein. This is because animal proteins can be better digested than plant-based proteins. Luckily there are plenty of good options.

pages.subtitle: Rice and beans is a great combination because together they provide a complete source of protein (all essential amino acids).

dailyContent.notificationText: How much of our food travels by air?¬†‚úàÔ∏è¬†- Recipe of the day: Pineapple Curry

home.title: How much of our food travels by air?

pages.title: Transport is usually a small part of the footprint of food.
Except when it is transported by air ‚úàÔ∏è
What percentage of all food miles is done by air? ‚úàÔ∏è

answerExplanation.text:
Only a tiny fraction of our food comes by plane. These products are usually soft and have a very short shelf life, such as berries or asparagus.

This means that eating ‚Äòlocally‚Äô is not a useful tip to reduce the footprint of your food. It‚Äôs much more important what type of food you‚Äôre eating (meat or veggies) and how it was produced.

pages.subtitle: While pineapple comes by boat, fresh sugar snaps and green beans are often transported by air. So from September until April, it‚Äôs a good option to buy them frozen.

dailyContent.notificationText: What‚Äôs the main reason that keeps people from eating less meat?¬†üòµ‚Äçüí´¬†- Recipe of the day: Orange Chilli Spaghetti

home.title: Why people don‚Äôt change

pages.title: As a user of this app you‚Äôre part of the group who is doing their best for the climate ü•≥
So how do we get your meat-loving family and friends to join?
What is the main reason that keeps people from eating less meat?

answerOptions.title: Not believing that meat contributes to climate change
Not willing to change their habits
Unable to imagine an alternative way of eating

answerExplanation.text:
Most people agree with the facts. But if you‚Äôre used to eating meat with every meal, it can be hard to imagine what an alternative looks like. 

The best way to convince people to eat less meat is to show them how delicious it can be. So throw a sustainable dinner party and send people the recipe!

pages.subtitle: This is a fantastic recipe to discover a completely new taste.

dailyContent.notificationText: How much protein is in a can of beans?¬†üèãÔ∏è¬†- Recipe of the day: Vegetable Jambalaya

home.title: How much protein is in a can of beans?

pages.title: Legumes - lentils, beans, peas, etc. - are a great source of protein üí™
How do they compare to animal products?
One can of beans has the same amount of protein as...

answerExplanation.text:
By including legumes into your meals you are drastically reducing your carbon footprint with a healthy source of protein.

While it‚Äôs true that meat is the easiest way to eat lots of protein, we already saw that we don‚Äôt need so much protein every day.

pages.subtitle: A great recipe to cook with a less common type of legume and source of protein: lima beans.

dailyContent.notificationText: The surprising footprint of food waste at home¬†üè†¬†- Recipe of the day: Cheesy Penne with Arugula

home.title: The surprising footprint of food waste

pages.title: One study from the UK looked at all the food that is thrown away at home üè†
And then calculated the total footprint of all this waste.
What has a higher footprint?
pages.subtitle: in households in the UK

answerExplanation.text: As you can see, drinks are part of food waste as well. Throwing milk or coffee down the drain also has a huge footprint. And again we can see that we are wasting a lot of bread and pasta.

pages.subtitle: This recipe uses canned tomatoes, which means no tomatoes were wasted in the process.

dailyContent.notificationText: Why does cheese have a high footprint?¬†ü•∏¬†- Recipe of the day: Lemon Rice with Hummus

home.title: Why cheese has a high footprint

pages.title: Cheese has a much higher footprint than other dairy products like yogurt. üßÄ¬†Why?
What is the main reason for the high footprint of cheese?

answerExplanation.text:
A piece of cheese looks small but there is a lot of milk ‚Äòhidden‚Äô in it. This causes most of the emissions.

Transport, packaging, or whether it comes from industrial or artisanal production only has a tiny influence on the carbon footprint.

pages.subtitle: The Middle-Eastern flavors of this recipe create a rich meal where you won‚Äôt miss cheese..

dailyContent.notificationText: Why we waste so much bread ü•ñ¬†- Recipe of the day: Easy Pesto Lasagne

home.title: Why do we waste so much bread?

pages.title: A German study looked at all the food that people waste at home üóë
And they also researched the reasons for throwing away food.
What was the main reason for wasting bread?

answerExplanation.text:
Bread waste is about our attitude: do we feel too good to eat a bread crust? Or do we see it as valuable food?

To solve food waste, we have to remind ourselves that food is our first basic need. It is too valuable to throw away, even if our old bread has become a bit hard.

pages.subtitle: Oven recipes are a great way to use old bread: just crumble it on top for a crunchy layer.

dailyContent.notificationText: A climate tip for cheese lovers¬†üßÄ¬†- Recipe of the day: Stuffed Bell Peppers

home.title: A climate tip for cheese lovers

pages.title: Soft cheeses like Mozzarella require less milk than hard cheeses like Parmesan üßÄ
So does that mean it‚Äôs better to eat soft cheese?
Which option has a lower footprint?

answerExplanation.text:
The type of cheese has a much smaller influence on the carbon footprint than the amount of cheese.

So our favorite tip to reduce the portion size of cheese: buy a high-quality parmesan and grate it yourself on the finest structure. This way you get a lot of cheese particles and flavor without using a lot of cheese.

pages.subtitle: Another way to reduce portion sizes is using small amounts of strong-tasting cheese, such as feta.

dailyContent.notificationText: What‚Äôs the impact of packaging?¬†üì¶¬†- Recipe of the day: Sweet Chilli

home.title: What‚Äôs the footprint of packaging?

pages.title: A lot of food arrives at our house in some form of packaging üì¶
What‚Äôs the impact of all this plastic, glass, metal, and carton?
Compared to the emissions from growing food, the footprint of packaging is‚Ä¶

answerExplanation.text:
Packaging is the food impact we see with our own eyes. What we don‚Äôt see is all the water, land, and energy that went into growing the food and this has a much bigger impact.

So it‚Äôs better to buy a can of tomatoes or a bag of lentils than zero-waste meat.

pages.subtitle: A recipe that uses a lot of cans. Now you know that it still has a much lower impact than a chilli con carne.

dailyContent.notificationTitle: Today: The Big Ranch (the last one!)
dailyContent.notificationText: Introducing a red meat budget¬†üçî¬†- Recipe of the day: Pita Bread with Mushrooms

home.title: Introducing a red meat budget

pages.title: Red meat - so pork and beef - has a much higher footprint than white meat ü•©
So if you still want to eat it, what is a sustainable amount?
What is a sustainable amount of red meat per week?

answerExplanation.text: In Europe and the US, we currently eat the equivalent of 5 hamburgers per week. Changing this number to 1 hamburger per week is the most important goal. This step alone gets us almost halfway to the sustainable diet calculated by the EAT-Lancet report.

pages.subtitle: A lot of red meat is used for fast food, but it‚Äôs easy to make a delicious pita with mushrooms.

dailyContent.notificationText: [This your¬†3Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£th day] What works best to inspire people to start a new habit?¬†- Recipe of the day: Balsamic Ravioli

home.title: How to convince other people

pages.title: We often see a sustainable diet as an individual problem.
But convincing one other person to change a little is much more important than making perfect choices by yourself üë´
What works best to inspire people to start a new habit?

answerExplanation.text:
People are not convinced by logic or shocking facts. The best way to start a new habit is to offer an easy solution that almost feels ridiculously easy. Like replacing beef with chicken.

This way people don‚Äôt feel overwhelmed. And when they achieve this small step, they will be motivated to keep going.

pages.subtitle: One of our most simple recipes. So it‚Äôs to also set a small step on busy days.

dailyContent.notificationText: Are you eating the right carbs?¬†üåæ¬†¬†- Recipe of the day: Garlic Lime Spaghetti

home.title: Are you eating the right carbs?¬†

pages.title: As we learned at Muscle Mountain, grains provide a lot of protein.
But not all grains are the same¬†üåæ¬†
How is whole-grain bread different from white bread?

answerOptions.title: It has been baked at higher temperatures
Outer layer of the grains has not been removed

answerExplanation.text:
The outer layer (bran) and germ have not been removed. This creates a flour that is a bit tougher to chew but also contains a lot more nutrients.

So in a way, choosing refined instead of whole grain is almost like a form of food waste: we are missing out on perfectly good nutrition.

pages.subtitle: A great dish for whole grain spaghetti. While not all types of pasta are available as whole grain variant, most supermarkets have whole grain spaghetti.

dailyContent.notificationText: The dark side of avocados¬†ü•ë¬†- Recipe of the day: Black Bean Fajitas

home.title: The dark side of avocados

pages.title: Avocados have become extremely popular¬†ü•ë¬†
And with its popularity, some problems have come up‚Ä¶
What is NOT true about avocados?

answerExplanation.text:
Most avocados come from Mexico, where forest is cut down to make space for them. They also use a lot of water and drug cartels are now also involved in the avocado business.

It‚Äôs a complicated product. That‚Äôs why we have given ourselves an avocado budget of 1 per month.

pages.subtitle: To keep avocados more special, we‚Äôve decided to only use them for authentic Mexican recipes, like these fajitas.

dailyContent.notificationText: The benefits of whole grain üåæ¬†- Recipe of the day: Zucchini and Peach Wraps

home.title: The benefits of whole grain

pages.title: Whole grain cereals are an important building block of a sustainable diet because they provide lots of nutrition for a low impact¬†üåæ
What is NOT a benefit of whole grain?

answerExplanation.text: Whole grain has enormous health benefits: it reduces the risk of heart disease, diabetes and extends your lifespan. The extra protein and fibre are also more filling so you become hungry less quickly.

pages.subtitle: With these wraps you can practice choosing the whole grain option.

dailyContent.notificationText: The total footprint of dairy¬†ü•õ¬†- Recipe of the day: Lazy Tortellini

home.title: The total footprint of dairy

pages.title: If we sum up the¬†emissions¬†of all dairy products the average Europeean eats throughout a year ü•õ‚Ä¶
Would it be higher or lower than the emissions from pork?¬†ü•ì
The total footprint of dairy is‚Ä¶
pages.subtitle: emissions per year in average diet in North America and Europe

answerExplanation.text:
Wow, we were a bit surprised by this!

The dairy impact is high because we eat so much of it: yogurt for breakfast, a butter and cheese sandwich for lunch and lasagne with lots of mozzarella for dinner.

pages.subtitle: In most tortellini types, a bit of cheese¬†is already hidden inside. That‚Äôs why there‚Äôs no need to sprinkle more on top.

dailyContent.notificationText: The impact of seasonal food üå±¬†- Recipe of the day: Sweet Potato and Lentil Curry

home.title: The impact of seasonal food

pages.title: How much does it really matter if something is grown in season or not?¬†üå±
Which type of spinach has a higher footprint?
pages.subtitle: in the Netherlands

answerOptions.title: Grown in season, transported from Spain¬†üöö

answerExplanation.text:
Seasonal food can make a real difference compared to the non-seasonal version from a heated greenhouse.

Location matters less than whether it was grown in season. That‚Äôs because the bulk of emissions usually come from production, not transportation.

pages.subtitle: A one-pot curry with spinach. You can buy frozen spinach if it‚Äôs not in season.

dailyContent.notificationText: Is chocolate bad for the climate?¬†üç´¬†- Recipee of the day: Caribbean Chilli

home.title: Is chocolade bad for the climate?

pages.title: Most people have learned about the importance of Fairtrade chocolate.¬†
But what about the climate impact?¬†üç´
What‚Äôs the biggest factor for the impact of a chocolate bar?

answerExplanation.text:
Chocolate is another product that causes deforestation. But at it‚Äôs best, it can also help to protect the rainforest. That explains why the impact of chocolate reaches from -4 kg CO2 all the way to 5x worse than beef.

This means it‚Äôs important to buy sustainable chocolate, which doesn‚Äôt contribute to further deforestation. The minimum should be Rainforest Alliance (the green frog logo).

pages.subtitle: Did you know that many chilli‚Äôs contain cocoa, too? This one contains another rainforest product - cinnamon.

dailyContent.notificationText: Where does all the milk go? üêÑ¬†- Recipe of the day: Chilli Spaghetti

home.title: Where does all the milk go?

pages.title: There are around 20 million dairy cows in the EU.
Where does most of the milk go?¬†üêÑ
What is most milk used for?
pages.subtitle: in EU

answerExplanation.text:
Most milk is used to make cheese and butter because both products require a lot of milk.

That‚Äôs why we looked at cheese in Moo Moo Meadows. In future stories we‚Äôll explore the other dairy products.

pages.subtitle: This Chilli Spaghetti is a great pasta recipe where you won‚Äôt miss cheese. Try it yourself!

dailyContent.notificationText: The protein power of carbs üí™¬†- Recipe of the day: Fennel and Orange Couscous

home.title: The protein power of carbs

pages.title: What most people don‚Äôt realize is that the average European gets more protein from cereals than from meat¬†üí™
Which of these contains the most protein?
pages.subtitle: per 100g of product

answerExplanation.text:
Wheat products like pasta and bread contain more protein than a lot of people think.

This means we often don‚Äôt even need to replace meat or dairy when eating wheat products. Especially because most people in Europe currently eat more than enough protein already.

pages.subtitle: Did you know that couscous is also made from wheat? Try this delicious Fennel and Orange Couscous.

dailyContent.notificationText: Why chickens are more sustainable than pigs¬†üêì¬†- Recipe of the day: Aubergine Tomato Curry

home.title: Why chickens are more sustainable than pigs

pages.title: We‚Äôve already seen that beef has a lot higher impact than pork and chicken.
But chicken is also more sustainable than pork. Why?¬†üêì
Why is chicken more sustainable than pork?

answerOptions.title: They can eat more sustainable feed

answerExplanation.text:
Both pigs and chickens are mostly fed with grain and soy beans. The main reason why meat from chickens has a lower impact than from pigs is because they are more efficient at ‚Äúconverting‚Äù this feed into meat and eggs (even though this is of course a sad way to talk about animals‚Ä¶).

The aubergine in this curry creates a meaty texture while the chickpeas add some protein.

pages.subtitle: The aubergine in this curry creates a meaty texture while the chickpeas add some protein.

dailyContent.notificationText: Is margarine more sustainable than butter?¬†üßà¬†- Recipe of the day: Fennel Risotto

home.title: Why chickens are more sustainable than pigs

pages.title: A lot of milk is used for butter production.¬†
But the vegetable oils that you need for margarine also have a high footprint.
What is the benefit of margarine over butter?

answerExplanation.text:
Oils have a relatively high footprint compared to vegetables and fruits. But they still have a much lower environmental footprint than dairy.

Again we draw the same conclusion: use margarine for daily use and butter for special occasions.

pages.subtitle: To make a delicious risotto, you need to add some butter (for special occasions¬†üòâ) or margarine at the end.¬†

dailyContent.notificationText: Tea vs Coffee ‚òïÔ∏è - Recipe of the day: Smokey Chilli

home.title: Tea vs Coffee

pages.title: Tea and coffee both grow around tropical forests and the world is drinking more and more of both. ‚òïÔ∏è
This means that in some areas forest is cut down to make more space.¬†ü™ì¬†But is the impact of coffee and tea the same?
Which drink has the lowest footprint?
pages.subtitle: based on CO2 emissions

answerExplanation.text: Replacing some of your coffee with tea can reduce your footprint. But the impact of the cappuccino shows us the priorities: reducing dairy or using plant-based alternatives is much more important.

pages.subtitle: A part of the smokey flavor of this delicious chilli comes from adding coffee!

dailyContent.notificationText: How mussels bring back life üåü¬†- Recipe of the day: Chickpea Wat

home.title: How mussels bring back life¬†

pages.title: A lot of our waters are polluted with run-off fertilizer or manure.¬†üí©
This means there‚Äôs too much nitrogen in the water, which creates dead zones.¬†‚ò†Ô∏è¬†Mussels are part of the solution.
How do mussels help with preventing water pollution?

answerExplanation.text:
Mussels filter the extra nitrogen out of the water. They then poop it out and it becomes sediment. A reef full of mussels also creates habitat for more fish.

So eating mussels is great for nature!

pages.subtitle: Legumes like chickpeas also help with nitrogen issues: their roots can feed nitrogen into the soil so a farmer needs less fertilizer.

dailyContent.notificationText: Seasonal food is great. But‚Ä¶¬†- Recipe of the day: Creamy Gnocchi

home.title: Seasonal food is great. But‚Ä¶

pages.title: We‚Äôve already seen that seasonal food can reduce your footprint¬†üçÅ
But there is a catch‚Ä¶
Seasonal food only makes sense if you also‚Ä¶

answerOptions.title: Buy it at a farmer‚Äôs market

answerExplanation.text:
Seasonal food can reduce your footprint, but it only covers a part of your diet that already has a low footprint.

Once you are eating meat and dairy at a sustainable level, seasonal food becomes more important, also for other reasons beyond the climate impact.

pages.subtitle: A summer recipe to enjoy when rocket, green beans, and bell pepper are in season.

dailyContent.notificationText: What you should know about salmon and tuna¬†ü¶à¬†- Recipe of the day: Saffron Pasta

home.title: What you should know about salmon and tuna

pages.title: Salmon and tuna are the two most consumed fish in the world.¬†
Both have something in common with sharks, which creates a probem¬†ü¶à
What is the biggest environmental issue around salmon and tuna?

answerExplanation.text:
Salmon and tuna eat other fish and are true carnivores. They are high in the food chain. This makes their role in the ecosystem extra important, but also more vulnerable.

Because you need to feed salmon with other fish, more than twice the amount of fish is needed for a piece of (farmed) salmon. So it‚Äôs much more sustainable to eat smaller fish.

pages.subtitle: Salmon has a unique flavor that‚Äôs hard to imitate. We don‚Äôt have any fish recipes, but this creamy pasta recipe with saffron might have an even more unique flavor.

dailyContent.notificationText: The benefits of seasonal food¬†üçÅ¬†- Recipe of the day: Sweet potato mash with sauerkraut

home.title: The benefits of seasonal food

pages.title: Eating seasonal food has so many benefits that it was hard to put it into a quiz question‚Ä¶
So instead, let‚Äôs test your seasonal knowledge¬†üòâ
Which vegetable is in season all year round?

answerExplanation.text:
When is the last time you had kale, white cabbage, or kohlrabi? üòâ Eating seasonal food helps us appreciate more vegetables and brings us more in touch with nature and the seasons and variations of our local food system.

It is a great way to support a farming system that is more connected to nature.

pages.subtitle: Here is your chance to cook with fermented white cabbage, also known as sauerkraut.

dailyContent.notificationText: The impact of one egg¬†ü•ö¬†- Recipe of the day: Nasi Goreng

home.title: The impact of one egg

pages.title: So far we‚Äôve seen that chicken has the lowest footprint of all meat.
But what about eggs?¬†ü•ö
The carbon footprint of 1 egg is‚Ä¶

answerOptions.title: Higher than a slice of cheese ‚¨ÜÔ∏è
Lower than a slice of cheese¬†‚¨áÔ∏è

answerExplanation.text:
Eggs have the lowest footprint of the most common animal foods. This is because chickens require less feed than pigs and cows.

Note that the egg in this infographic is twice as heavy as the other products, so for the same weight, the impact is even lower.

pages.subtitle: Nasi Goreng is delicious when you serve it with a fried egg.

dailyContent.notificationText: What‚Äôs the most sustainable milk?¬†ü•õ¬†- Recipe of the day: Tagliatelle with Pesto Rosso

home.title: What‚Äôs the most sustainable milk?¬†

pages.title: By now we‚Äôve seen lots of example of the high footprint of cow milk.¬†
What is the best plant-based alternative?¬†ü•õ
Which milk scores best?
pages.subtitle: looking at multiple environmental impact variables

answerExplanation.text: All three have a lower impact than cow‚Äôs milk. Looking at lots of other environmental factors, oat milk scores the best. Soy milk is the best option if you‚Äôre looking for a high-protein option.

pages.subtitle: What counts for milk is also true for cream.¬†Because soy cream is most widely available and has a neutral taste we suggest that in our recipes, but feel free to substitute for oat cream.

dailyContent.notificationText: What coffee can teach us about the circle of life ‚òïÔ∏è - Recipe of the day: Peanut Fruit Rice

home.title: What coffee can teach us about the circle of life

pages.title: In an earlier story of Wild Waste we saw that a lot of coffee is wasted ‚òïÔ∏è
The process of making coffee can also teach us a lesson about waste in general¬†üóë
Why does the coffee process create a lot of waste?

answerOptions.title: Only a small part of the fruit is used
A lot of coffee fruits rot during harvest

answerExplanation.text:
Producing food means taking out nutrients from the soil. If we don‚Äôt give them back through compost, the soil degrades. Our goal should be to create a circle of life, just like in the Lion King.

Used coffee grounds still contain a lot of nutrients. A small thing you can do is using coffee grounds as fertilizer. Just sprinkle them over the soil of one of your plants or garden!

pages.subtitle: Peeling vegetables or fruits is often unnecessary and creates waste. So it‚Äôs not needed in the case of carrots and apples you need for this recipe.

dailyContent.notificationText: The surprisingly high footprint of rice¬†üçö¬†- Recipe of the day: Aubergine Tomato Curry

home.title: The surprisingly high footprint of rice

pages.title: The footprint of rice is almost three times higher than bread and pasta!¬†üçö¬†Why?
Why does rice have a high footprint?

answerOptions.title: Only small part of the plant is used for consumption

answerExplanation.text:
Rice is grown in flooded paddies. This creates an environment without oxygen and releases methane. The same thing also happens on a landfill, which is why food waste can also cause methane.

There are ways to reduce the methane emissions of rice productions. That‚Äôs why Project Drawdown lists this as part of the top solutions for climate change.

pages.subtitle: The footprint of rice might be higher than pasta, but it‚Äôs still relatively low. So please don‚Äôt add rice to the list of foods you‚Äôre trying to avoid and enjoy this curry¬†üòâ

dailyContent.notificationText: The underrated power of soil¬†ü™±¬†- Recipe of the day: Roast Potatoes with Mustard

home.title: The underrated power of soil

pages.title: This is your 50th story!¬†üéâ¬†To celebrate that we‚Äôre introducing one of the most underrated topics: soil.
For a long time, we didn‚Äôt understand soil. It was only seen like a container of dirt that holds plants.¬†üì¶
But recent science has discovered that soil is more like an underground jungle full of life. One teaspoon of healthy soil contains billions of organisms.¬†ü™±
Soil is important for climate change because‚Ä¶

answerOptions.title: It can absorb more heat than the ocean¬†‚òÄÔ∏è
It stores more carbon than all forests¬†üå≥

answerExplanation.text:
Healthy soil contains a lot of carbon and is the foundation of life. But industrial agriculture is destroying healthy soil at alarming rates. This not only endangers our food production but also releases a lot of CO2.

The good news is that more sustainable forms of agriculture can restore soil. In following stories we will explore how all of this relates to our food choices.

pages.subtitle: Mustard is a good cover crop: farmers can use it to protect and improve the soil.¬†

dailyContent.notificationText: Discover why not all grass is the same¬†üå±¬†- Recipe of the day: Oven Polenta

home.title: Not all grass is the same

pages.title: A lot of grasslands for cows is a specific variety called ‚Äòperennial ryegrass‚Äô¬†üêÑ
This type of grass grows fast and has a lot of nutrients¬†üå±¬†But it comes at a high cost‚Ä¶
What‚Äôs the main issue with most grass for cows?¬†üêÑ
pages.subtitle: in relation to perennial ryegrass

answerExplanation.text:
Many grasslands for cows are industrial monocultures. They require a lot of fertilizer, damage the soil, and have no flowers or other diversity. Because of this they should be seen as industrial parks or green deserts rather than nature.

The same is true for those ‚Äòperfect‚Äô lawns üòâ

pages.subtitle: Did you know that corn also belongs to the grass family? Polenta is a powder made from corn.

dailyContent.notificationText: The real reason local food is important¬†üìç¬†- Recipe of the day: Brussels Sprouts with Apple

home.title: The real reason local food is important

pages.title: ‚ÄòEat local‚Äô is one the most common tips to eat more sustainably¬†üìç¬†But why is it important?¬†
What is an important reason to buy local food?
pages.subtitle: the most important among these three

answerOptions.title: To support local varieties of products

answerExplanation.text:
There are around 7500 apple varieties but most supermarkets around the world all have the same Granny Smith and Golden Delicious.

It is important to support a diversity of vegetables and fruits (we‚Äôll see why in a later story). So go to a farmers‚Äô market from time to time, to stay in touch with the food traditions of your own region.

pages.subtitle: For this recipe you can use any kind of local sweet apple.

dailyContent.notificationText: How does fish compare to other meat?¬†üêü¬†- Recipe of the day: Spanish Rice

home.title: How does fish compare to other meat?

pages.title: We‚Äôve already discovered a lot about meat from land animals. Time to look at ‚Äòsea meat‚Äô¬†üêü
Which type of fish has the lowest footprint?

answerExplanation.text:
The carbon footprint of fish is similar to chicken, but smaller fish like ansjovies or herring are a better option.

Only looking at CO2 can be misleading because there are other issues like overfishing. Also in that regard, smaller fish or mussels are a better choice.

pages.subtitle: This recipe was inspired by a paella, which is traditionally made with shrimp.¬†

dailyContent.notificationText: What you should know about yoghurt¬†ü•õ¬†- Recipe of the day: Carrot Cauliflower Biryani

home.title: What you should know about yoghurt

pages.title: Understanding the production process of yoghurt can teach us something about the impact of dairy products¬†ü•õ
How does yoghurt become thicker than milk?¬†ü•õ

answerOptions.title: Evoporating the water in the milk
Using a special type of milk

answerExplanation.text:
Yoghurt is created by adding special bacteria. The bacteria eat the sugars and thicken the milk. Through this process you can get 1 liter of yoghurt from 1 liter of milk.

That‚Äôs why yoghurt has a much lower footprint than cream, cheese, or butter, which require a lot more milk. Generally you can say the more fat a product contains, the more milk was used.

pages.subtitle: Try this recipe from India with yoghurt!

dailyContent.notificationText: How much meat did our grandparents eat?¬†ü•©¬†- Recipe of the day: Leek and Lentil Quiche

home.title: How much meat did our grandparents eat?

pages.title: Today, the world eats around 5 times more meat than in 1961.
Overall, most of this increase happened in Asia because many people live there. But what if we look at meat consumption per person?
Where did meat consumption increase more?
pages.subtitle: per person since 1961

answerExplanation.text:
In Europe and North America, meat consumption was already quite high. And then it further increased by one third.

The EAT Lancet report calculated what a sustainable of meat per person could look like: 16 kg per year. That means Europeans need to go from having meat multiple times a day, to eating meat 2-3 times a week.

pages.subtitle: A meatless quiche that will convince any meatlover.

dailyContent.notificationText: Do you know where most of our water is used?¬†üí¶¬†- Recipe of the day: Potato and Pesto Bake

home.title: Most water is used for‚Ä¶

pages.title: Even though we live on a blue planet, fresh water is extremely rare. Most of it is salty or locked away in ice¬†üßä
To provide every human with enough water, we need to use it more responsibly.
Where is the least amount of water used?
pages.subtitle: worldwide

answerExplanation.text:
Of all the water we withdraw from rivers, lakes or underground storage, 70% is used for agriculture. That means our food plays an important role in taking good care of water.

In some European countries, industry uses the most water but household is usually the smallest share.

pages.subtitle: Potatoes are one of the food products with the lowest water footprint.

dailyContent.notificationText: Biodiversity is important. But why?¬†üåº¬†- Recipe of the day: Beetroot and Pumpkin Curry

home.title: The beauty of diversity

pages.title: Imagine a field full of flowers¬†üåº¬†The more colors and diversity, the more beautiful it looks!
Biodiversity is not only nice for the eye, but also important for farming¬†üßë‚Äçüåæ
Diversity on a farm is important because it‚Ä¶

answerExplanation.text:
If all apple trees are the same and one of them gets sick, they all get sick and we don‚Äôt have any apples. This is a big risk because plant diseases are more likely with climate change.

Diversity is one of the most important features of a healthy ecosystem. It also creates more unique flavours, supports local food traditions and creates a more beautiful landscape üôÇ

pages.subtitle: A simple way to support diversity is cooking (plant-based) meals with lots of different colors!

dailyContent.notificationText: The damage of chemical fertilizer¬†‚ò†Ô∏è¬†- Recipe of the day: Sweet Potato and Beetroot Tart

home.title: The damage of chemical fertilizer

pages.title: Chemical fertilizer can boost the growth of crops in the short-term üå±
But it ‚Äòborrows‚Äô this productivity from the future because it damages the soil¬†‚ò†Ô∏è. And that‚Äôs not the only issue.
Chemical fertilizer‚Ä¶

answerExplanation.text:
We often hear about the emissions of food transportation, but fertilizer causes more than double the emissions.

It costs an enormous amount of energy to manufacture fertilizer. And when it is spread on the field, micro-organisms in the soil convert it to laughing gas, adding even more emissions.

Often farmers also use too much fertilizer, which creates serious water pollution.

pages.subtitle: Like we‚Äôve seen before, legumes are good for the soil. Here we use hummus as the ‚Äòsoil‚Äô of these delicious tarts.

dailyContent.notificationText: How a ‚Äòwater footprint‚Äô works¬†üí¶¬†- Recipe of the day: Minty Aubergine Wraps

home.title: How a ‚Äòwater footprint‚Äô works

pages.title: The water we use for showers or irrigation comes from rivers, lakes or underground storage. It‚Äôs called ‚Äòblue water‚Äô¬†üöø
For agriculture, we also need to take a look at ‚Äògreen water‚Äô¬†üí¶
What is green water?

answerOptions.title: Water used to dissolve polluting particles¬†‚ò†Ô∏è
Water stored in the soil through rainfall¬†üåß

answerExplanation.text:
Blue water is directly taken from rivers, lakes, or underground storage. This is the water used for showers or irrigation.

Agriculture has another large ‚Äòhidden‚Äô aspect of water that also matters: green water. This is stored in the soil through rainfall. Together they create the water footprint of a food product.

pages.subtitle: Avocados are very thirsty plants so we wanted to create delicious wraps without the need for avocado.

dailyContent.notificationText: The footprint of tomatoes in winter¬†üçÖ¬†-¬†Recipe of the day: Chickpea Tajine with Peaches

home.title: The footprint of tomatoes in winter

pages.title: Tomatoes are the most popular vegetable in Europe¬†üçÖ. They‚Äôre a summer vegetable, but you can now buy them year-round.
There are several ways in which supermarkets offer tomatoes during cold winter months¬†‚ùÑÔ∏è
What type of ‚Äòwinter tomato‚Äô has the highest footprint?

answerExplanation.text:
Of course, seasonal food is the best option. But during winter months, canned food is also a good option. Canned tomatoes are harvested during summer. In the can they remain fresh anda are often tastier than tomatoes from a greenhouse.

It‚Äôs easy to feel decision stress with all these options. Just keep in mind: eating fewer animal products is more important than buying the most sustainable tomato.

pages.subtitle: These canned ingredients help to create a delicious meal around the celeriac, a ‚Äòforgotten‚Äô vegetable for the winter months.

dailyContent.notificationText: How legumes improve the soil ü´ò - Recipe of the day: Sweet Potato and Lentil Curry

home.title: How legumes improve the soil

pages.title: By now you‚Äôve seen that legumes are great for the climate ü´ò Let‚Äôs find out how exactly that works.
What makes the roots of legumes special?

answerOptions.title: They allow the soil to store more water¬†üí¶
They add nitrogen to the soil ‚ö°Ô∏è

answerExplanation.text:
Nitrogen is a key ingredient for plants. Instead of using nitrogen, legumes ADD it nitrogen to the soil. This happens through a ‚Äòpartnership‚Äô with bacteria that like to live around their roots.

This means that farmers can use legumes instead of nitrogen fertilizer, which saves emissions and has lots of other benefits.

pages.subtitle: A delicious curry with lentils to improve the soil!

dailyContent.notificationText: There are millions of pigs in the Netherlands. Where are they?¬†üê∑¬†- Recipe of the day: Vegetable Jambalaya

home.title: Hidden pigs

pages.title: The Netherlands uses a star system to show the wellbeing of animals. A meat product can have 0-3 stars ‚≠êÔ∏è
Only the pigs with 2 or 3 stars live in a stable where they can go outside¬†üê∑
How many of the pigs in the Netherlands never come outside?¬†

answerExplanation.text:
Unfortunately it is very difficult to find 2-3 star pork. The animal welfare of pigs is a serious issue.

We often see cows in the fields, while pigs are hidden out of sight. You never see them, even though there are way more pigs than cows in the Netherlands and the EU.

pages.subtitle: Smoked paprika powder is an excellent way to replace the taste of bacon of other meat.

dailyContent.notificationText: What is organic farming? üë©‚Äçüåæ¬†- Recipe of the day: Red Cabbage Stir-fry

home.title: What is organic farming?

pages.title: Organic food is not just a label but also a mindset. ü§ì
To better understand organic farming, we need to compare it with industrial agriculture.
What is industrial agriculture?

answerOptions.title: Using chemicals to grow the most food possible üß™
Creating bigger farms to save money üí∞

answerExplanation.text:
Industrial agriculture is all about output: getting more food from the land, by any means necessary. This made food production very efficient but it‚Äôs also destroying the soil we depend on.

Organic agriculture is about keeping a balance between healthy soil and food production. That‚Äôs why it uses crop rotations, manure, and compost.

pages.subtitle: A recipe with apples, one of the products it‚Äôs easy to buy the organic version.

dailyContent.notificationText: What does sustainable coffee look like? ‚òïÔ∏è - Recipe of the day: White Wine Mushroom Tagliatelle

home.title: What does sustainable coffee look like?

pages.title: Coffee and cacao plants and trees originally grow in the shade of the forest üå≥
But to increase production, many farms now grow coffee or cacao directly in the sun ‚òÄÔ∏è
That means forest is cut down to make space for the plantations ü™ì One of the solutions is ‚Äòagroforestry‚Äô.
What does sustainable coffee look like?

answerOptions.title: Cutting trees in a sustainable way

answerExplanation.text:
Agroforestry is mixing food production with forest. That makes it possible to turn coffee plantations into forests. The quality also improves because there is more shade.

The best way to find these products is to look for high-quality, single-origin coffee or chocolate. It‚Äôs more transparent where it comes from and often more sustainable and fair.

pages.subtitle: This recipe includes walnuts. And since those come from trees, they can also come from agroforestry systems.

dailyContent.notificationText: Here are some easy ways to add extra protein üí™¬†- Recipe of the day: Celeriac Sweet Potato Mash

home.title: The easiest way to add more protein

pages.title: Nuts and legumes are a great source of protein ü´òü•ú¬†
Especially because you can easily add them to any meal.
Which food has the most protein? üí™
pages.subtitle: per 100 g

answerExplanation.text:
We already discovered that most people worry too much about protein. But if you eat completely plant-based, it is useful to know which foods add protein to your meal.

A hand full of pumpkin or sunflower seeds is a great way to add some extra protein. They also provide a tasty crunch to any meal, from yogurt to rice and pasta.

pages.subtitle: The pumpkin seeds in this recipe provide some extra protein and crunch.

dailyContent.notificationText: The story of farmed fish üêü¬†- Recipe of the day: Mushroom Ginger Noodle Soup

home.title: The story of farmed fish

pages.title: Before humans started farming, we hunted wild animals for meat üèπ. This caused the extinction of many big mammals like the mammoth.
Fishing is like hunting üé£. And because of that, many fish are endangered. As a solution - like we did with animals on the land - we started fish farms.
What do farmed fish and farmed meat have in common? üêüüêñ

answerOptions.title: It requires land to grow their feed

answerExplanation.text:
Farmed fish causes the same problems as farmed meat: it takes lots of land to feed them. Sometimes farms even catch wild fish to use as feed. Overall it‚Äôs the same problem in water as on land: we want to eat products that require a lot of feed.

Instead, we need to eat lower-impact foods. Nuts and legumes from the land. Mussels, smaller fish like herring, and seaweed from the ocean.

pages.subtitle: Farmed fish are fed with soy. Better to eat it ourselves, like in this recipe, where we use tofu.

dailyContent.notificationText: The impact of organic food üå±¬†- Recipe of the day: Caponata

home.title: The impact of organic food

pages.title: A French¬†study¬†showed that organic products decrease your carbon footprint. But there is a twist.
Organic food only reduces your footprint if you also‚Ä¶

answerExplanation.text:
Organic farming has lots of benefits but there is one downside: it requires a bit more land. So if we want to keep eating the same amount of meat, we would have to use even more land to grow the animal feed.

The solution is eating less meat and dairy. This frees up lots of farmland we can then use for organic agriculture.

pages.subtitle: Wheat products usually require a lot of chemical fertilizer, so buying organic pasta is a great choice.

dailyContent.notificationText: What‚Äôs the impact of using soy cream?¬†üêÑ¬†- Recipe of the day: Creamy Pear Pasta

home.title: What‚Äôs the impact of using soy cream?

pages.title: Maybe you‚Äôve noticed that we mention ‚Äò(soy)cream‚Äô in our recipes.
It means that we leave the choice up to you: use soy cream or dairy cream¬†üêÑ
But we started wondering: what‚Äôs the difference? So we calculated the impact for our ‚ÄòCreamy Pear Pasta‚Äô¬†üçù
Replacing dairy cream with soy cream saves the same CO2 emissions as‚Ä¶

answerOptions.title: Leaving out the pasta¬†üçù¬†(520 g CO2)
Leaving out the pears¬†üçê¬†(280 g CO2)

answerExplanation.text:
Cooking with 250 ml soy cream instead of dairy cream cancels out the footprint of 400 grams of pasta! That is more than we thought.

If you can‚Äôt find it in your local store, don‚Äôt feel too bad. But for anyone who wants to do their best, cooking with plant-based cream is a step worth taking.

pages.subtitle: You can also use other plant-based cooking cream, but we like soy cream the most.

dailyContent.notificationText: What Europe needs to do about palm oil¬†üå¥¬†- Recipe of the day: Indonesian Spicy Cabbage

home.title: What Europe needs to do about palm oil

pages.title: As we discovered in the ‚ÄòFading Forest‚Äô, palm oil is a big cause of deforestation¬†ü™ì
While most palm oil is used as cooking oil in Asia, Europe also imports 20% of the world‚Äôs palm oil¬†üå¥
Where is most palm oil used in the EU?

answerExplanation.text:
The majority of palm oil in the EU is used as biofuel. The good news is that it will be phased out by 2030. Still, the question is what it will be replaced with.

Here we have to draw a conclusion that‚Äôs not about food: ride your bike or take public transport more than a car!

pages.subtitle: A tribute to Indonesia, where most palm oil comes from.

dailyContent.notificationText: What you should know about water pollution¬†‚ò†Ô∏è¬†- Recipe of the day: Thai Peanut Curry

home.title: Dead zones in the water

pages.title: Today we‚Äôre going to look at ‚Äòeutrophication‚Äô. It‚Äôs a process where rivers, lakes and the ocean become polluted¬†üåä
It starts when water has too many nutrients. This causes the growth of algae at the surface and blocks sunlight¬†ü¶†
In the end, plants and fish suffocate and die¬†‚ò†Ô∏è
Where do the polluting nutrients come from?

answerExplanation.text:
In Europe and the US, most of the pollution comes from agriculture. In other regions it also comes from wastewater.

The products with the highest pollution are meat and dairy. That‚Äôs because their feed requires so much fertilizer. And because of the high-energy feed, their poop is then also full of extra nutrients and causes pollution.

pages.subtitle: The best way to reduce water pollution is eating more plant-based. Curries are always a great option!

dailyContent.notificationText: The unfair price of rice¬†üçö¬†-¬†Recipe of the day: Fennel Risotto

home.title: The unfair price of rice

pages.title: Many of the products we enjoy in Europe come from tropical countries. Often, those farmers and workers don‚Äôt get paid enough¬†üë®üèæ‚Äçüåæ
For example, a rice farmer in Thailand only gets 56% of what they need to make a decent living¬†üí∏
The average price for white rice in the Netherlands is ‚Ç¨ 1.69 per kg¬†üçö¬†If the farmer gets paid a fair amount, how much would it increase the price?
How much would the price increase?¬†üçö
pages.subtitle: to provide a decent living standard, assuming that rice costs ‚Ç¨ 1.69 per kg

answerExplanation.text:
Farmers and workers of many products get significanlty underpaid. But it wouldn‚Äôt actually cost much to fix this problem.

To better understand why this happens, we need to explore where most of the money ends up. That‚Äôs for the next story in Fair Fields.

pages.subtitle: Arborio rice for risotto doesn‚Äôt come from Thailand, but from Italy.

dailyContent.notificationText: Which food would not exist without pollinators?¬†üåº¬†- Recipe of the day: Beetroot and Pumpkin Curry

home.title: The pollinator team

pages.title: Many plants rely on insects to spread their pollen and reproduce üåº
Bees are the most famous pollinators but lots of other insects like butterflies and flies are also part of the team¬†ü¶ã
Which food would not exist without pollinators?

answerExplanation.text:
The good news is that the foods we eat most of - rice, wheat, and potatoes - are not dependent on pollinators. But a lot of the foods that make life better are dependent: from apples to chocolate.

That is one of the many reasons why it‚Äôs important to care for the pollinator team.

pages.subtitle: Pumpkin is another product that wouldn‚Äôt exist without pollinators.

dailyContent.notificationText: The only downside of nuts¬†ü•ú¬†- Recipe of the day: Garlic Lime Spaghetti

home.title: The only downside of nuts

pages.title: We‚Äôve seen that nuts are full of protein and have a much lower footprint than meat¬†ü•ú
But when it comes to water use, they‚Äôre in the same category as beef‚Ä¶¬†üíß
Which nuts have the lowest water footprint?

answerExplanation.text:
Peanuts and walnuts use the least water. But it‚Äôs true that especially almonds, cashews, and pistachios are very thirsty plants. This is a problem in dry areas.

At the same time, nuts score MUCH better than meat on all other environmental issues. That means they are still a good source of protein in the transition to a more sustainable food system.

pages.subtitle: Peanuts have the lowest water footprint of nuts. They usually work well in rice recipes, but here they are a great fit for this pasta.

dailyContent.notificationText: The footprint of home delivery¬†üè†¬†- Recipe of the day: Creamy Cabbage Potato Mash

home.title: The footprint of home delivery

pages.title: Imagine found you‚Äôve found a really nice farm shop in your area that sells organic vegetables¬†üë©‚Äçüåæ
You can buy their veggie box at the shop but they can also send it to your house¬†üì¶
If the farm shop is 4 km away, which option has a lower footprint?
pages.subtitle: assuming both drive on petrol

answerExplanation.text:
As we discovered before, food miles have a much lower footprint than people think. But there is one case where every mile matters: when you‚Äôre driving yourself! Because that‚Äôs a lot of emissions and traffic for only one delivery, compared to a truck full of veggie boxes.

At Fork Ranger, we don‚Äôt believe that everything should be delivered 24/7. More convenience is not the solution to a sustainable world. But if the alternative is driving a car, delivery is usually the better option.

pages.subtitle: Even though food miles are not a useful measure, buying local food is still important for other reasons. This recipe uses lots of ingredients from the Netherlands.

dailyContent.notificationText: How to get enough vitamin B12¬†‚ú®¬†- Recipe of the day: Carrot Cauliflower Biryani

home.title: How to get enough vitamin B12

pages.title: There is one nutrient that‚Äôs difficult to get with only plants: vitamin B12¬†‚ú®
The EAT-Lancet report calculated what a healthy and sustainable diet should look like. Overall, it‚Äôs about eating lots of veggies, legumes, and nuts¬†ü•¶ü•ú
But meat and dairy also play a role and provide the recommended amount of B12¬†ü•õ
What is the recommended amount of dairy per day?¬†ü•õ
pages.subtitle: according to the EAT-Lancet report

answerExplanation.text:
If you eat according to the EAT Lancet diet, you should get enough vitamin B12. Many plant-based meats and dairy alternatives also contain B12.

If you eat less meat & dairy than this, it‚Äôs important to pay attention and consider a Vitamin B12 supplement.

pages.subtitle: Of all dairy products, yogurt has the lowest footprint. And in this recipe it‚Äôs a delicious addition!

home.title: How much does our food contribute to climate change?

pages.title: How much does our food contribute to climate change?
pages.subtitle: yearly greenhouse gas emissions worldwide

answerExplanation.text:
Our global food system causes one third of all emissions. 

On your Fork Ranger journey you‚Äôre going to explore the most important sources of these emissions and what we can do about it.

pages.subtitle: This was the first Fork Ranger recipe and it has become a favorite of dozens of people.

home.title: What can save more CO2 emissions?

pages.title: What can save more CO2 emissions?

answerExplanation.text:
The most effective way to reduce the footprint of our food is eating less meat and dairy.

You don‚Äôt have to become a vegetarian to be part of the solution. A few simple changes can make a massive difference.

pages.subtitle: Most of us need to eat more veggies and this recipe makes that a lot easier.

home.title: The most effective solutions for climate change

pages.title: Which solution can save the most CO2?

answerExplanation.text:
At Fork Ranger, we are inspired by the fact that there are some very human solutions that can save a lot more CO2 than technology.

It‚Äôs all about finding a new way of living that is in harmony with nature:
- less meat, more plants
- less flying, more local adventures
- less stuff, more memories

pages.subtitle: One of our most simple recipes. So it‚Äôs to also set a small step on busy days.
